recommendations for a policy matrix. The taxation expert will review the existing tax system
(corporate and income tax, property tax, and other relevant obligatory payments) and assist the
team leader in developing recommendations for a policy matrix. The statistician will collect all
relevant data  and  liaise with  the  suppliers  of  data  such  as  the  National  Statistical  Office,
National Bank of Kazakhstan, and commercial associations. The business support specialist will
work  closely with  the  international  consultants  in  line with  the  terms  of  reference,  with  a
particular emphasis on a review of existing business support schemes on national and regional
levels. All domestic  consultants will put a strong emphasis in their work on gender-specific
issues.
EE..  Auditors (about 2 person-months of services by an international auditor and 8
person-months by domestic auditors)
5.  The auditors will undertake a financial review of up to five financial intermediaries
selected for the SME financingf acility. The auditors will assess the overall financial soundness
of the intermediaries with special reference to overall solvency, liquidity, profitability, and
prudential ratios established by the regulatorya  uthorities. For banks, the auditors will assess
the intermediariesi nterest margins, overhead expenses,v olume of past due loans, volume of
classified loans by grade, volume of other nonperforminga ssets, and extent of off-balance
sheet liabilities.  The  auditors will  assess the adequacy of  loan  loss provisions using
iinntteerrnnaattiioonnaalllyly a acccceepptteedd  ssttaannddaarrddss  aanndd  eexxpprreessss  aann  ooppiinniioonn  tthheerreeoonn..  TThhee  aauuddiittoorrss  wwiillll  ddiirreeccttllyy
review loans accounting for at least 60 percent of the total loan portfolio in terms of value and at
least 5 percent in terms  of numbers. The auditors will also  review the  performance  of the
intermediaries'  SME portfolio. The auditors will prepare financial  projections for the financial
intermediaries in line with ADB requirements.
Workshops
6.  In addition to consulting services, the TA consultants will provide two workshops on SME
development  for  representatives  of  the  Government,  international  aid  agencies,  business
support institutions, SMEs, and commercial banks. Participants in the workshops discuss SME
development in Kazakhstan as well as aspects of the proposed ensuing sector development
program.
G.  Reporting Requirements
7.  The team leader will prepare an inception report and a time-bound work program within
four weeks of commencement of services, mid-term report covering the review components,
and a draft final report covering all required recommendations. The final report will be produced
within two weeks after the tripartite meeting to review the draft final report. All the reports as
required above will be prepared both in English and Russian.
